Step 4: Once all pins have been raised, quickly release the tension tool and insert a thin, flat tool, such as a knife or a piece of plastic, into the keyhole to push the pins down simultaneously. This action should unlock the lock. Step 5: Finally, turn the lock with a gentle twist to ensure that it has opened successfully.
